solemn two articles i read this morning
bright side of wrong
http://www.boston.com/bostonglobe/ideas/articles/2010/06/13/the_bright_side_of_wrong/?page=4

emotional response:
i'm worried that this type of thinking could lead to the overly optimistic, bubble-conducive environment that another video warned against . it's important not to cross the line between understanding that errors are part of our brain and casually blaming error for everything, which then becomes recklessness.

what happened to studying
http://www.boston.com/bostonglobe/ideas/articles/2010/07/04/what_happened_to_studying/?page=4

emotional response:
it's the same debate i'm having now. i don't know whether to study more or less. i want the college life but at the same time, learning so much more out of those four years than anyone else, esp with technical majors like CS or engine.
